#summary how to use jMock in your specs
This page is under construction

= Introduction =

[http://www.jmock.org/ jMock2] allows to define mocks and expectations on mocks very easily.

This page shows how to use jMock with specs. Please refer to the jMock site for instructions on how to use mocks and define expectations.

= Libraries =

In order to use jMock2 with specs, you need to add the following dependencies to your project:
{{{
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.jmock</groupId>
      <artifactId>jmock</artifactId>
      <version>2.4.0</version>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.hamcrest</groupId>
      <artifactId>hamcrest-core</artifactId>
      <version>1.1</version>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.hamcrest</groupId>
      <artifactId>hamcrest-library</artifactId>
      <version>1.1</version>
    </dependency>   
    <dependency>
      <groupId>cglib</groupId>
      <artifactId>cglib</artifactId>
      <version>2.1_3</version>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.objenesis</groupId>
      <artifactId>objenesis</artifactId>
      <version>1.0</version>
    </dependency>
}}}
